How are the 15 new double perovskite derived halides synthesized?
data.answer: Via solution methods using organic cationic ligands, RbNO3/KBr, and Bi2O3 mixed in aqueous HBr/HI and heated to boil.

data.question: True or False: The iodide phases exhibit nonmonotonic changes in photoluminescence intensity with temperature.
What structural types have been obtained for the new Bi-based double perovskite derived halides?
True or False: The majority of the new phases are centrosymmetric.
What is the effect of the organic cationic ligands used in the synthesis?
data.answer: They coordinate with the B site alkali metal (K, Rb) with a sp3 oxygen atom, breaking the original B-centered octahedra and creating larger distortions.

data.question: True or False: The optical band gaps of these double perovskite derivatives are mostly determined by the alkali metal component.
What is the range of band gaps for iodide phases?
True or False: The band gaps are similar among the derivatives with the same halide, suggesting that [BiX6] dominantly determines the value of band gap.
What is the role of temperature in the photoluminescence (PL) emission intensity for the bromide phases?
data.answer: The PL emission intensity increases with decreasing temperature for the bromide phases.

data.question: True or False: The organic ligand coordination strategy results in all of the materials crystallizing in centrosymmetric space groups.

True or False: The optical band gaps can be fine-tuned by changing the organic cationic ligands.
What is the significance of the non-centrosymmetric nature of most materials in this series?
data.answer: It creates new opportunities for applications for non-linear optics.

data.question: True or False: The bromide phases exhibit broadband STE emissions regardless of the dimensionality or connectivity mode.
What is the role of DFT calculations in understanding the electronic structures of these double perovskites?
data.answer: DFT calculations reveal that these double perovskite derived halides are indirect gap semiconductors.
